TITLE.P: Logistics and tracing in sterile supplies

SHORT_DESCR.P: The contract shall be implemented in accordance with a decision where the Regional Health Authority West decided to introduce traceability for all sterilisation units in the region. The service includes the implementation of an electronic system for logistics and tracing in the Sterile Supply Unit that supports the infection control scheme. Electronic documentation and tracing of surgical instruments, in accordance with the Regulations dated 28.10.2016 on management and quality improvement of the health and care services, effective from 1.1.2017. The Contracting Authority would like tenders for the procurement and maintenance of an electronic system for logistics and traceability for all sterile units included in Helse Vest. The contracting authority uses Mercell Sourcing Service.
See the information in the “version change” point on the postponed tender deadline and postponed deadline for submitting questions.

The contract shall be implemented in accordance with a decision where the Regional Health Authority West decided to introduce traceability for all sterilisation units in the region. The service includes the implementation of an electronic system for logistics and tracing in the Sterile Supply Unit that supports the infection control scheme. Electronic documentation and tracing of surgical instruments, in accordance with the Regulations of 28.10.2016 regarding management and quality improvement of the health and care service, effective from 1.1.2017.

This system shall provide the Regional Health Authority West well documented, and ensure traceability options for sterile equipment used for treatment of patients. Traceability is in this context defined as tracing and following a re-processed instrument, through all chains of production, processing and distribution. Tracing/documentation of the cleaning/disinfecting process for medical instruments before they are sterilised. This is considered as a part of the documentation and tracing for the entire sterile supply chain.

The contracting authority requests tenders for the procurement and maintenance of an electronic system for logistics and traceability for all sterile units included in the Region Health Authority West.
See Part 2 SSA-T Annex 1 — Requirement Specifications and Part 3; SSA-V Annex 1 — Requirement Specifications for more detailed information.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The Contracting Authority wants an option for extending the agreement to include the following users/private non-profit organisations: Haraldsplass Diakonale Sjukehus (HDS) and Hospitalet Betanien.

TITLE.P: Logistics and tracing in sterile supplies

INFO_ADD.P: The competition is cancelled due to a lack of competition — all the tenders were rejected as they exceeded the Contracting Authority's budget.
